title: Sharon Osbourne reveals she won’t work with Simon Cowell ever again
text:
Louis Walsh, Sharon Osbourne and Simon Cowell at the National Television Awards in 2007 (Picture: Jon Furniss/WireImage)

Sharon Osbourne has responded to Simon Cowell after he expressed how he’s open to working with her again, and the feeling isn’t exactly mutual.

Simon, 60, recently stated he’s open to working with Sharon, 67, again despite giving her the boot from The X Factor, claiming the pair had buried the hatchet over a phone call.

Sharon has since responded to his comments by explaining how there wasn’t a feud to begin with, but she’s rejecting any idea of working with Simon again in the future.

Speaking on US chat show The Talk (via Yahoo News), Sharon said: ‘Well, we were never, for me, not, not friends. Because for me, it was business, not personal. And there’s a huge line.’

She added: ‘That’s what happens when you work with people that you like. You fall out business-wise, but for me, I say what I feel at the time, and for me, it’s over.

‘And because I said certain things about, and to, Simon, doesn’t mean I hate him forever, just for that second I don’t like him… I never use the word hate when I talk about people. He’s okay, it’s just, I don’t want to work with him.’

Sharon Osbourne at the Emmys in 2019 (Picture: Steve Granitz/WireImage)

Sharon also claimed on Monday’s episode of The Talk the pair haven’t spoken in over a year, despite Simon’s comments alleging they had a phone call recently.

‘The “other day” was May 2018!’ Sharon said.

Sharon was a judge on The X Factor from 2004 to 2007, before reappearing on the 2013, 2016, and 2017 series. She was lined-up to appear on the 2018 series, but released a statement shortly after the competition began stating she’d decided she was no longer needed.

Back in March, Sharon claimed Simon fired her from the 2018 series because she was ‘too old’.

‘I turned down a judge [gig] on The Masked Singer,’ Sharon said in March. ‘I was signed on to do [X Factor]. I was signed to go to England, and then Simon Cowell changed his mind and thought I was too old.

‘Simon Cowell goes, “She’s old. We need somebody young.” So if you want young, fire yourself.’ Simon’s reps denied the allegations at the time.
